values:
I'm sorry I haven't updated in a while, but things have become somewhat overwhelming.

I found out yesterday that I've been kicked out of my high school, and that I have another IEP meeting tomorrow.  As if one meeting wasn't enough.

On top of that, I still have to finish the buttload of homework I've gotten since I was suspended.

Sometimes I wish I could just go to sleep and stay that way so I could just be lost in my dreams and not have to deal with all this shit.

Oh my goodness, I'm having a marvelous time.

We're staying at my aunt's house in Henderson, which is about ten minutes from the Strip.  We've been going to all the casinos and stuff, which is fun, but since I'm not 21...*sigh*

At least I have Phoenix Wright: Ace Attorney to keep me company.

Last night, we went to see a Cirque du Soleil production called 'Love'.  It was absolutely amazing.  The costumes were beautiful and the music was, of course, awesome.  How could it not be, when the whole show was a tribute to the Beatles?

Well, I'm off to play with Phoenix some more.  Maybe I'll update tomorrow, if I've got the time.

This time tomorrow, I'll be on a plane to Las Vegas.

Go me.

I saw this today, and I was just like...oh, man.

THIS IS NOW CANON.  NO DISPUTING.  >:O
I wish I knew.

My grandmother had a heart attack and she's in the hospital.  My dad says that she's probably not going to last for very long. 

Even if she lives through her stay, there's a good chance she won't be able to go back to her farm.  She'll have to live in a nursing home, and the fact that she won't be able to live in her own house is going to destroy her.  Her and my grandfather, before he died, owned the property for over fifty years.  He built their house and tilled the soil with his own hands, and just knowing that she'll never be able to go back home absolutely breaks my heart. 

I know that her death is inevitable, just like everyone else's.  It's just that I honestly don't think I'm ready to lose my last remaining grandparent.

When you pick up habits, even just for a brief moment, it's hard to stop.  They're just like cigarettes--they're so addictive.

I guess sometimes what you think is making you better is really making you worse.

I don't know what I need.

I feel...powdery.  Not actually powdery, as in covered in powder, but I'm in the strangest mood and I don't know how else to describe it.

It's a little melancholy, a little nostalgic.  I feel like a long empty road and a full tank of gas but an vacant passenger seat.  I feel like a song that gets stuck in your head but you only know three lines to it, and of course they're the ones that you can't sing it out loud.  I feel like cookies you can't finish baking because you realized half-way through that your oven is broken.  Like a mixed tape that got heat-warped, but it only ruined the very last song on side B (and you never really liked that song anyway).  Like a hardboiled egg that burst its shell in the pot.  A crayon wrapper peeled off by chubby toddler fingers and stuck to the table. 

Now aren't you glad that you read that?  

How many seconds of your life will you never get back?

I don't wanna hear your bitching or your whining.  I know you're the favorite.  Shut the fuck up.  

"What're you doing here?"  
"Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't know you were coming."

I wasn't prepared for your intense insanity.  I'm not six years old anymore, which makes you not sixteen.  Act your age, since I've got the decency to act mine.  Oh, I forgot.  You can't.  

You're just jealous because I'm the baby.  Shut the fuck up.  I can't help it!  It's not my fault!  SHUT THE FUCK UP!
 
Oh wait, Elle can't do that.  Elle doesn't have any friends.  Elle has problems.  She isn't normal.  Of course she doesn't have any friends.  Oh, Elle, don't be such a baby; I was only kidding.

YOU ARE NOT MY PARENT!  SHUT THE FUCK UP!

I used to look up to you.  I used to worship every step that you took.  I used to follow you around.  Want to know why?  Because I wanted to be just like you.  JUST like you.  I thought you were so cool, but now I thank God we're two different people.  Thank God I'm not like you.
 
You are stubborn.  
Selfish.  
Arrogant.  
Mean.  
Harsh.  
Controlling.

You never share the attention.  You gloat when you get it and I don't.  You never help me out.  You treat me like your daughter...but you're not exactly a good parent.  You treat me like I'm stupid, like I'm five, like I can't function in the real world because I have 'problems'.  You always think you know best.  You never listen to what other people have to say.  You always think what you have to say is the most interesting thing anyone could be listening to at any given moment.  You have no patience and a quick temper. You never change your mind, even when you know you're wrong.  You don't talk to me anymore.  We used to share secrets--well, whatever secrets you could tell a six year old.  You don't tell me anything now.  You don't trust me.
 
They don't see it, and you know they don't.  They just love you, you little fucking angel.  Miss Perfection Queen.  When you appear, they drop everything and run to your side.  They don't even notice me anymore, and you don't do anything to stop it.  Suddenly, everything I do is wrong.  You become a brat, and they fuel you.  I can't win.  I cannot fucking win when it comes to you.  SHUT THE FUCK UP! 

And you know what the whole bitch of it is?

I STILL LOVE YOU.

And you?  You don't love me.  In fact, it's even worse...





...you pity me.
I've got me a little <u>Lord of the Rings</u> marathon going on here.  Don't interrupt.

HAPPY SAINT PATRICK'S DAY, BITCHES.

Love, Elle

I'm through with these pills that make me sit still.

I honestly am.  I am so tired of taking pills in order to feel better.  Every day, all I hear is "Take your Lithium", or "Don't forget your Geodon", or "Do you need your Lorazepam?  You seem agitated."

I DON'T WANT TO TAKE THIS FUCKING MEDICATION.

Sometimes...well, a lot of times...I feel like there's nothing wrong with me.  Nothing.  I feel like bloody well know that I am just like everybody else, that I am not an object, that I am a human-fucking-being, and that I am being medicated for no reason.

I just get so annoyed, you know?  My doctors take me into their offices and prescribe me these awful-tasting pills and ask me how I'm doing, if everything's okay, if I need help, and they look at me with pity, like I'm some sick little puppy that can't take care of herself.  Why can't anybody see that I can handle this?  Oh, but no, nearly EVERYBODY gives me the "our poor little manic-depressive doesn't know what she's saying"  fucking look, like I should be fucking committed.

The worst part is, I end up proving them right, time after time...for the most part, anyway.  I do the stupidest fucking things like you wouldn't believe, and for some reason, I usually have no explanation.  If I do, it's always too idiotic-sounding to say.

At the expulsion meeting, the officers said that I was 'dangerous'.  I almost laughed.  Dangerous?  Dangerous to whom?  I've never gotten into a fight before, nor do I have any desire to hurt anyone (unless you count those select few that I absolutely cannot stand, but that's only when they open their mouths, and even then I'm not going to carry those wishes out...I mean, everybody has those feelings).  I'm not particularly dangerous to myself.  Yes, I cut, but I also know when to stop.  I'm not going to carve deep enough so that I can see the muscle structure underneath.  I don't want to die, you know.  Not really.  I do enjoy many parts of my life, it's just that I don't handle negative emotions very well.

I know I have problems, but I am not crazy.  I'm not.  I just wish that that could be enough for everybody else.

It's nice to know that you have at least one or two people who will always be there no matter what.  You know, friends that will always catch you before you fall.  Honestly, I don't really need anybody else in my life if I have that.  I don't care what falls apart, who leaves me, or what changes...I know that somebody will have my back.  I'm slowly learning that it's definitely quality over quanity when it comes to friends.  Fuck having a lot of friends who don't give a shit, 'cause if you have just a couple that do, they are so much better.  Granted, I do have a few more than just a couple of friends (and when I say a few, I mean only a few ^_^;;), but I feel as though those two individuals make more of a difference in my life than the other ones ever could.  I could have an awesome time hanging out with them and doing the stupidest shit in the world.  We'd just be sitting in some random-ass room with nothing but a television, a game system, and some weed, and we'd have the greatest time ever.  I love it.

This doesn't mean that I don't care about my other friends; it's just that two of them in particular mean a whole fucking lot to me.
I just thought that this was amazing.  And bloody helpful.

The hearing was all right.  Nerve-wracking, but all right.

Everybody made it clear that I would not be expelled, which made things much better, but that didn't mean I wasn't glad to get the hell out of that room.  I guess it helps that this has been the only disciplinary action I've faced during my entire academic career. 

But I still don't know what's going to happen to me.

Yes, it's 6:41 PM.  Yes, I'm really fucking tired.  Yes, I'm going to bed.

Well, I have my expulsion hearing in a few hours.  I really hope I don't have to switch school districts, because switching schools is bad enough.  If I had to wake up earlier than I already do, that'd be absolute torture.

My teachers said I'd be all right, my principal in particular.  They said that since the MDR went well and that what happened was directly related to my emotional disability, everything should more or less work out in my favor.

That doesn't really make me any less nervous, though.  :(

As you can see, I got a LiveJournal.

(Translation: I'm too fucking lazy to actually write stuff, so I'm going to stare at a blinding screen and clickety-clack on a keyboard for x amount of minutes when I can.  Hooray?)

Well, now that I'm here, I might as well ramble on about what happened today.

I finally finished my last SOL.  Richard woke me up at some ungodly hour and took me over to the school, where I proceeded to write about the given prompt until my hand felt like it was going to fall off.  Mr. K. proctored the test, which was nice.  He's probably my favorite teacher at my high school.  After I had finished the test, he proceeded to worry over me:

"How are you doing?"
"I'm good, thanks for asking."
"I heard about what happened on the Friday before last...are you sure you're okay?"
"I'm fine, really."
"So what's going on?  Are you coming back to school, or are you leaving for good?"
"Well, I've got the hearing tomorrow, so I guess we'll see what happens then."
"Good.  I hope you come back.  I can honestly say that you've been one of the best students I've ever had, and I'd really hate to lose you."

D'awww.  *blush*

I saw some of my friends today in passing.  I got a bunch of hugs, which felt good.  It's a great feeling when you know that people that you've only known for a month actually miss you.

And then I went home and had curry.  Mmm, curry.
